page.title: 12FISHING AT WOODFORD
page.content: In the river there are mainly{trout and{grayling.}Also there are other freshwater fish such as salmon, pike,roach and smaller fish. {FISHING FOR TROUT. Trout}will bite at any bait. The{fishermen}try to imitate natural movements of the flies at that time of year. In May mayflies are a popular bait, then from June onwards nymphs are used as bait (these are the offspring of dragonflies and other creatures). {SALMON.}The 'hen' fish digs a hollow in the gravel where she lays the eggs. The 'cock' then fertilises the eggs and they begin to form. After a year the developed{salmon}swim out to sea. Some go far out to sea, but others stay near the coast. After about two years the{salmon}will return to the river to be caught.
